Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation a hotel Van Gogh but my parents (quite aged) were upgraded in the Acca hotel because a lift was available. What to say? Hotel Acca were a little better than Van Gogh but both were in bad condition. I think they'll sell the structure because it needs some works. The location on the contrary is good because the Van Gogh museum and other are very near. The breakfast was included in the price but was really basic. There was a lady giving you a bread slice, some milk and coffe, butter and marmelade. The only advantageous think is the price and the personal (upgrade for my aged parents).

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CoalvilleTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Van Gogh is on a small pedestrianised area opposite the Van Gogh museum. Whilst the location is excellent (with a tram stop nearby) the hotel has to be the worst I have ever stayed in. The service at reception was non-existent and the room filthy and poorly equipped. When the heating came on my friend went to reception to complain only to come back with a dirty blanket to put on top of the bed. Breakfast was included but the 'restaurant' appeared to be the owners living room (i.e. no matching furniture and looking out onto a cluttered yard) and after the first day we decided to go to a local cafe. Overall the hotel has a feel of being a stopover for illegal immigrants. There is nothing at all to recommend this I can't imagine why anyone would want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 2BigTrips/Year
Reviews.Content: To get to our room on the 4th floor, we had to lug our luggage up about 120 very narrow stairs. Then we entered the worst hotel room that we've ever had. It was roomy enough, and the location was fine, but the room itself left much to be desired. I had accepted our travel agent's recommendation, because he had managed to find us a room for only $200/night in Amsterdam, whereas everything I had seen was more like $400 and up. Unfortunately, I had only read the online reviews of the hotel a couple of days before we went on our vacation. Luckily, we did not encounter a rat on our bed or drooping ceilings in our bathroom, covered with mold. We did, however, have a toilet that continually leaked, leaving the (marble) bathroom floor continuously wet. A close examination of the toilet revealed that the leak came from the tank, not from the bowl or the plumbing that takes away the waste. That, at least, was heartening. Still, a wet bathroom floor isn't fun. We sacrificed one of the 3 towels we were supplied with, as a permanent mop/rug. And we learned that we could turn off the water to the toilet, so it wouldn't run and leak continuously. In the room itself, all but one of the electric outlets was bare or pulled out from the wall. There were some end table lamps, but there was nothing to plug them into. The furniture in the room was the type that a college student would not accept, because it has been used for so many years. The beds were OK, though, and the overhead light worked. We slept OK, and didn't encounter the bed bugs that some other guests had complained of. Such a deal, for $200/night. The breakfast was fine -- nothing special. Some other reviewers of this hotel said they were afraid to try the breakfast. We did, and it was fine. It consisted of as much coffee as you wanted, bread with nutella or fruit jam, a slice of cheese, and a slice of sandwich meat. The front desk staff and the breakfast staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a joke!!!”
Reviews.Author: JacobPerth
Reviews.Content: it's beter for you to not stop in this hotel,evrything is wrong,specially when you dont have electric power in your room and the light is flashing alltime .

Reviews.Title: “Squalid, dirty and dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Hazel_9
Reviews.Content: I would strongly advise against staying in this hotel. As well as being extremely run down the rooms are dirty - apart from the beds being made we had no cleaning during our stay. One of our party thinks she may have got fleas from the bed. The carpets in the hallways and on stairways are badly torn, a hazard in the even of a fire. I am amazed this hotel is rated three star and can charge what it does.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: lilymarlene
Reviews.Content: How does this hotel manage to be listed with 3 stars? It is not up to 1 star standard. Fortunately we only stayed one night. The whole place is shabby, scruffy, run down and falling to pieces. The first room we were given had no light shades, just bear bulbs and only one of these worked. The net curtains were streaked brown from cigarette smoke and the wardrobe was only fit for fire wood. We then wasted part of our stay in Amsterdam waiting for a change of room, which at least was a little better, although I've discarded beds in better condition. Don't stay there, you'll be very disappointed if you do!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ultraviolett
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a very shabby and scruffy hotel. For hygienic reasons donÂ´t stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice”
Reviews.Author: World69
Reviews.Content: Ugly hotel. I stayed 6 nights. It's rated as 3 stars but in reality it doesn't deserve more than 1-2 stars. Dirty bedspread, burnt furniture, lean breakfast (no buffet and always the same). They don't change towels at all (even if leave them on the floor)

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: badacca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was purely disgusting. I woke in the middle of the night to a mouse sitting on my suitcase, eating my airline tags. I went to the front desk, where they told me it's normal to have mice in the summer. Nice. [--] this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the others claim”
Reviews.Author: mixtape
Reviews.Content: I just came home from a weekend stay at Acca. After reading these reviews I was so terrified, but I was happy to find out that we had a big room with four single beds. Clean sheets, clean room. The bathroom was clean, but not the nicest one. It had some strange spots on the walls, but you get what you pay for. We chose this hotel because we wanted something cheap. Well, to be the cheapest hotell we could find in Amsterdam, it was a lot better than we expected. I also felt very safe that the receptionist was very strict with giving out the key, we almost had to show ID. And he always asked where the others were if we didn't go home all four at once. I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Pony”
Reviews.Author: TonyT78
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam, staying in this absolute pile of flith hotel. The lift didn't work, there were no batteries in the TV remote and the room was in a terrible state.. I travelled with my moaning wife and she hated it more than me, I would recommend people stay away from this hotel at all costs. Ps - The staff were very helpful and it was in a great location but the hotel needs to be torn down and rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in a street gutter first if you can”
Reviews.Author: adampowell
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place in Amsterdam. We booked two twin rooms but the manager tried to palm us off with a huge, cold, filthy, dangerous, unhealthy,smelly dorm style room with four single beds, one wardrobe (with no doors, it's own graffiti, no hangers or rail) and a bathroom we felt dirtier coming out of! He gave us an extra room eventually but we didn't use it on the second night as we felt safer all sleeping together in one room. We didn't try the breakfest after imagining the condition the kitchen must be in. Honestly, trust the reviews on this site. We didn't and regretted it.

Reviews.Title: “Why has this hotel not being closed for public health reasons?”
Reviews.Author: Besharps
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I ever stayed in. I paid for two nights but only stayed for one. Please save yourself the pain and book into a proper hotel. To sum up my experience here are a few of the highlights: Vomit stained carpets in the hallways Dodgy and scary lift Dodgy fire escapes Poorly lit hallways (probably to hide the vomit stains) Dodgy room door locks (do not bring valuables with you and I wouldn't recommend leaving them in the hotel 'safe' either) Bathroom is more a wet room and is by no means hygienic No hot water Dirty towels Blood stained implement found in room Evidence that room was broken in to previously My door lock for the night was some furniture that I moved in front of the door to prevent it been broken into Blood on the underside of my pillow (which I only notice in the morning) Dead insect which I suspect was a bed bug or other parasite (again I only noticed this in the morning) Please do not stay at this hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: gsterLondon
Reviews.Content: 3 words of advice: Don't do it! Just have a look at the photos posted....

Reviews.Title: “flea pit”
Reviews.Author: lindyloocardiff
Reviews.Content: Do not get this one mixed with the Acro which is just up the road where our friends were staying, so we had something to compare with. Certainly not 3 star, I wouldn't give it a 1. Rooms I am sure are let out by the hour. We didn't even get up for breakfast ofter the first morning, not worth the effort. One of the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as these reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: Aberdeendon
Reviews.Content: From reading some of the other reviews I was prepared to be staying in an absolute dump but in reality its ok. The bedding was clean, as was the bathroom and the staff were friendly and helpful. Its really close to Leidseplein and Heinken Experience is walking distance too. Dont have champagne taste and beer money, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “discusting dirty an very unsafe, passport stolen from LOCKED room”
Reviews.Author: toasted151
Reviews.Content: from the entrance lobby this place didnt look too bad. seemed like the perfect cheap deal. when we got to check in at 3 oclock (they said 8am would be fine) we unpacked our bags an put our clothes away. we stupidly left our bags in the room...dont leave anything here. The next day when one of our group needed to take his medication for epilepsy he realised his bag had gone from the locked room (the doors lock behind you automatically. Within his bag was two important drugs that he needs to keep him alive and his passport. Staff in the place where not even bothered. We had to travel to a hospital, a chemist and 2 police stations all the biggest distance you can imagine from each other. which was difficult for our wheelchair bound member of the group. The walls an carpets where full of stains, the bathroom looked like somethin from 1973. DO NOT EVEN THINK about going here. The amsterdam police and paramedics where excellent. Amsterdam is an amazing an beautiful place, the hours of hell this caused where outweighed by lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: pmarshal
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews are accurate, however this is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for. I went with my wife and 2 children (9 & 12) and stayed in room 316. There were lots of small problems (lights, bathroom), however it was clean and we slept well. The breakfast was basic, but fresh. The staff were very helpful. What you get here is a great location at a budget price. Worst hotel I've ever stayed in, yes, but also the cheapest city centre one.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: brindles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I treated our Son and his partner as a 30th birthday present to this trip of three nights in Amsterdam. This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and you can imagine our embarrasment in taking our son and partner into this place. On arrival the staff were rude and hostile. The first day we were there the lift broke down and we were on the fourth floor. The steep stairs and carpet were highly dangerous with the bannisters wobbling and very unsafe, the carpets were threadbare and lifting in places with unmentionable stains everywhere, even up the walls. The rooms were tatty, awful and grubby. The first morning we went for breakfast and it was terrible, the tables were dirty and the cups and teapots etc were badly stained and we were presented with dry bread jam and ham. The dining room walls and carpet were also very dirty with electric wires hanging out of the ceiling, very dangerous. That was the first and last time we went for breakfast. The whole stay was absolutely horrendous and we would strongly advise people not to waste their money and stay in this hell hole, we were so glad to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy: Try anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: BeyondDukkha
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this hotel was terrible. Unfortunately a booking error with Asia Rooms left us desperate days before arriving. Having read the reviews, we decided Hotel Acca's proximity to the Van Gogh Museum might be a saving grace for us, and it was one of the few still available. I wish we'd tried harder. The reception staff were unhelpful and rude. We had booked 2 twin rooms, but were given doubles. Which were totally inappropriate. We were not offerred a discount and only one room was changed. The rooms were really small, unclean and stank. The sink in our bathroom did not connect to the drain, thus when we turned the sink on, it wet the entire bathroom floor. In our friends room, the mould and soap scum deterred them from trying to shower at all. And we have stayed in some questionable hostels in Europe. The hotel does not provide a secure lock up for your luggage during the day, so you leave it at your own risk. And it is a massive risk, as the room it is kept in is accessible to all guests and out of the view of the hotel staff. For the price we paid Â£72 we were ripped off and not happy. Do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam alone and I found this hotel 'Acca Van Gogh' the location is great, the reception place and the receptioners were friendly and great, you stay in front of van gogh museum, the bedroom was nice and the breakfast was ok. Emanuele from Carrara (Italy)

Reviews.Title: “'House of Horrors'”
Reviews.Author: Iloveholidays000
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is the house of horrors. We were a group of 5 girls from the UK staying for 3 nights. Upon arrival we were given the basement rooms. The first basement room was disgusting - it had 4 grotty 'beds', very little lighting, a view of the tip from the window, holes in the wall where there had been a fight from the previous occupants, and for some unknown reason a massive blob of wet toilet paper stuck to the wall (presumably to cover up a hole?). Hotel manager had no shame about the state of the rooms and said 'it's amsterdam what do you expect - if we fixed these things, they would just get broken again so what's the point'. The second basement room was just as bad but more bearable because of the heat blasting from the radiators and a few more lights. Dodgy stain on the bathroom floor (looked alot like old blood) and yet more holes in the walls. We did mange to change the first basement room for a double room on the second floor - although the room was slightly better, the bathroom was hideous (avocado green and filthy) and the shower was more of a drip. Thin walls too - my friends woke up to the sound of their neighbours coughing/wretching/vomitting down the corridor. Nice. Breakfast consisted of bread (not even toasted) with slices of ham and cheese. that was it. tea/coffee if you were lucky. We only had breakfast one day because it was so awful. The lights even went out when we were half way through our 'meal' - not sure if this was due to fuse blowing (no cooking was being done so don't know how this could have happened) or money in the meter running out. Certainly not a 3* although the manager will beg to differ - and charges as if it's a 3*! Our opinion of the hotel was shared by most guests we met in the breakfast room that morning. Don't go there!!! Photos to follow....

Reviews.Title: “The terrible Acca.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunate enough to be in a group of twelve who stayed at the terrible Acca. The Lobby area is good and confortable, the rest of the Hotel?? should be condemned how any sane person even give it a one star rating is beyond me. The rooms were dirty lighting had been removed and wires painted over the W.C seat was broken,plumbing was not attached to the basin. The radiator in the bedroom was off the wall and not working,the bedding was dirty in general I will never again stay in this dump.A hostel would be more comfortable

Reviews.Title: “hotel more like smoketel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: six of us stayed for one night thank god only one we had three rooms ours being the best dirty and very smelly the breakfast was a joke ate out the staff were very nice and helpfull hotel not good

Reviews.Title: “3 star no way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where do i start the smell that greeted us as soon as we entered the lobby was enough, a bar was non existant, stains on the carpets, had a balcony room had to push the chair against the door to keep it shut, you could hear every single movement throughout the hotel just as good we only used it to sleep in, the breakfast was a joke would not recommend this.........I WAS GOING TO SAY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “i mean............its west”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: go if ya in a big group and dont mind stayin in a not so clean not so nice hotel. the loby looks really nice, but the second you walk down to rooms you know its a bit of a hole. stayed in the basement rooms, large and away from everywhere else so you can ave a massive group smoke and play music and no one gives a ----.

Reviews.Title: “We laughed from the minute we entered the Acca Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh where to start!!!! We being 5 fun loving Irish lassies arrived at the glass doors of the Hotel Acca at around 11.30a.m on a sunny september mornig,only to discover that we shared our entrance to the hotel with a Primary school yard,there were screaming children everywhere! On entrance to the building everything seemed fine and there was the cutest little bar hidden away in the corner PERFECT......Anyway I won't keep you much longer,short & sweet- the room was very dissapointing. It was dull & dreary but it had a lovely balcony for which to drop water bombs on the heads of those screaching children!!!(only joking) After all the room was only for sleeping in and the location was unbeatable. So we went about our merry way discovering all the sites and sounds of Amsterdam and on our return requested a drink in the little bar we spotted earlier. The receptionist/barman/handyman etc. opened the bar and took our orders for vodca & beer. He had enough for three vodkas and had one bottle of beer. Hmmmmm we thaught this is going to be some laugh!!!!!! So we went to the Off Licence & baught our own drink and supplys and made our way back to the lounge in the hotel,from that moment on we realized that had we not chosen to stay in the Acca,our stay would not have been quite so memorable,we felt so relaxed and at home the whole time. It was fab! The next day we kept our fingers crossed that the bar had not been stocked up,so we could have another cheap night in,and lo and behold our wish was granted!!!!! I plan on going back to Amsterdam in early 2006 and I will definately be booking into the Acca,simply for the atmosphere it was spot on and really reasonably priced for the location. What an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked our annual St Georges Day trip to Amsterdam this year and unfortunately choose the Awful Acca without reading travellers advice. What a mistake!!!!! It can only be described as a dump and being given 3*'s is taking the p***, The room's (or should I say sespits) were a disgrace - filthy bed linen, stained carpets and mold covered bathrooms. Believe me this HOTEL (now there's a joke) is not even up to 3 world standards and I'll go as far to say even the airport toilets were cleaner!!!!! Having arrived quite late we had to endure 1 night in this filthy hole before checking out first thing the next morning and changing hotels. DON'T DO IT....................

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in that "dump" for 3 nights. It was a really a bad experience. (Dirty tiny bathroom, dirty floor, ackward bed position, and tiny room) Breakfast consisted in the following mandatory ingredients: 4 pieces of bread, choice of 2 types of jam, 2 cuts of ham, 2 cuts of cheese, a cup of coffe and a juice.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our one night stay”
Reviews.Author: davieg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the ACCA on Saturday 4th September 2004, the hotel seems to be in two parts one is 'new' and one is 'old'. We were in the new part. We were two adults and two children, one at 13 one at 1.5 and I can't find any fault with our stay at the hotel, the staff were friendly and helpful, the room was large, 1 dbl, one single , a travel cot as requested, and a huge very modern bathroom, we had a balcony too. As I say the two previous reviews are at odds with ours but we were very pleased with our stay, as said easy access for trams and the local 'designer shops' and museums etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ACCA hotel from Friday to Sunday. The glass dome was leaking in the lobby and there was a funny smell throughout the hotel. The heating pipes banged all night Friday night! The receptionist lady was lovely - very friendly, men didn't have much to say. Breakfast is brown or white bread, butter with jam/nutella and juice and coffee and that's it! (We only had one breakfast the to eat our in the area was dear at â‚¬10.50 for a full english!) If you do have breakfast, it's brought to you by the (very slow) staff. There were beer bottles left on our balcony! The ACCA is right across from the Van Gogh Museum and down the road from the Rijks Museum so very central from that point of view. The trams run from the bottom of the road 1 and 5 go into the Centre. I would say to grown ups to stay there only if you've already booked in (as we had), no children!

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: nellyhickey
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the acca hotel for a week,first of all it should'nt be allowed to be called a hotel,our bathroom had leaking water pipes,the heating did'nt work for the first 3 days,we were freezing and it was not possible to get any food in the hotel whatsoever apart from ordering pizza after 6 o clock. the beds were also very badly covered our bed cover was filthy dirty from the first day and was only changed once in the week we were there. i would not reccomend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Acca/Van Gogh
HotelInfo.Address: Van de Veldestraat 3A, Amsterdam 1071 CW, The Netherlands
